item.title: Rajiv Bajaj counters L&T Chairman's controversial ‘90-hour work week’ remark, says ‘let it start from the top’ | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Rajiv Bajaj counters L&T Chairman’s controversial ‘90-hour work week’ remark, says ‘let it start from the top’

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

Amid ongoing controversy over L&T chairman S N Subrahmanyan's 90-hour work week remark, Rajiv Bajaj, Managing Director of Bajaj Auto, emphasized the importance of quality of work over quantity, suggesting that if a 90-hour week is to be enforced, it should start from the top management.

  • Rajiv Bajaj stated, 'Let 90 hours start from the top' during an interview with CNBC-TV18.
  • S N Subrahmanyan's comments about working on weekends sparked backlash, with many industrialists and politicians voicing their concerns.
  • Bajaj criticized the notion of long hours, advocating for improved outcomes through better leadership and empowerment of employees.
  • RPG Group’s Harsh Goenka also spoke against the excessive work hours, calling for a balanced work-life approach.
  • L&T clarified that Subrahmanyan's comments were intended to inspire extraordinary efforts for the nation's progress.
“Number of hours of work doesn’t matter, quality of work does. We need a kinder, gentler world more than ever before.” - Rajiv Bajaj

In conclusion, the discourse surrounding work hours continues to evolve, balancing productivity demands with the necessity for employee well-being.

item.title: SENSEX, NIFTY extend losses into 3rd session on surging crude prices, FII outflows - Upstox
item.description:
SENSEX, NIFTY extend losses into 3rd session on surging crude prices, FII outflows

Date: Friday, Publication Source: Not specified

Equity benchmark indices SENSEX and NIFTY faced losses for the third consecutive session due to concerns over economic growth and rising crude oil prices.

  • SENSEX dropped 241.30 points to close at 77,378.91.
  • NIFTY fell by 95 points to settle at 23,431.50.
  • Major laggards included IndusInd Bank, NTPC, and Tata Steel.
  • Tata Consultancy Services reported nearly a 6% increase in net profit.
  • FIIs sold off equities worth ₹7,170.87 crore on Thursday.
  • Global markets, including Asian and European stocks, closed lower.
“Surging crude oil prices and a strengthening dollar index contributed to the weak trend in equities.”

The persistent losses in SENSEX and NIFTY reflect broader concerns regarding economic conditions and market performance.

item.title: Factory output growth hits 6-month high of 5.2% in November, says Govt data - The Hindu
item.description:
Factory output growth hits 6-month high of 5.2% in November, says Govt data

Published: January 10, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

India’s industrial production (IIP) growth accelerated to a six-month high of 5.2% year-on-year in November 2024, driven by increased festive demand and a pick-up in the manufacturing sector.

  • The IIP recorded a growth of 2.5% in November 2023.
  • Previous high growth rate was 6.3% in May 2024.
  • Growth in factory output for April-November 2024 was 4.1% compared to 6.5% in the previous year.
  • Manufacturing sector growth accelerated to 5.8% in November from 1.3% a year ago.
  • Consumer durable goods production grew by 13.1% during November 2024.
  • Infrastructure/construction goods reported a growth of 10% in the same month.
"The capital goods segment growth accelerated to 9 percent in November 2024 against a contraction of 1.1% in the year-ago period."

The data indicates a significant recovery in the industrial sector, highlighting the importance of consumer demand during the festive season.

item.title: Laxmi Dental IPO: 10 key points to consider before ₹698 crore offer opening - Upstox
item.description:
Laxmi Dental IPO: 10 Key Points to Consider Before ₹698 Crore Offer Opening

Publication Date: January 13
Source: Upstox

The ₹698 crore IPO of Laxmi Dental is opening for public subscription on January 13. The price band is set between ₹407 and ₹428 per share, with shares expected to be listed on January 20.

  • The IPO subscription period runs from January 13 to January 15.
  • Anchor investors can bid on January 10.
  • The IPO involves new equity shares worth ₹138 crore and an offer-for-sale of 1.31 crore shares worth ₹506.06 crore.
  • Price band is set at ₹407 to ₹428 per share.
  • 75% of shares are reserved for qualified institutional buyers, 15% for non-institutional investors, and 10% for retail investors.
  • Minimum investment size is ₹14,124 for one lot of 33 shares.
  • Funds raised will be used to clear debt and purchase new machinery.
  • Book-running lead managers include SBI Capital Markets and Motilal Oswal.
  • Allotment date is expected on January 16.
  • Shares will be listed on the NSE and BSE on January 20.

Laxmi Dental specializes in B2B2C dental aligner solutions, including custom crowns and advanced digital dentistry.

Laxmi Dental Financials

ParticularsFY22FY23FY24H1FY25
Revenue₹136.84 cr₹161.63 cr₹193.56 cr₹116.78 cr
Net Profit/(Loss)₹(18.68) cr₹(4.16) cr₹25.23 cr₹22.74 cr

item.title: More VRRs, swaps, OMO buys needed from RBI to address rupee's tightening liquidity: Nomura - Moneycontrol
item.description:
More VRRs, swaps, OMO buys needed from RBI to address rupee's tightening liquidity: Nomura

Date: January 10, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

According to the report, RBI has been intervening "heavily" in the FX over the past two months, causing a drain on the INR liquidity.

  • Nomura emphasizes the need for more Variable Rate Reverse repos (VRRs), swaps, and Open Market Operations (OMOs) by the RBI.
  • There are indications that further Cash Reserve Ratio (CRR) cuts might be necessary.
  • The intervention by RBI in the foreign exchange market has significantly impacted liquidity in the Indian rupee.
“Further CRR cuts cannot be ruled out and that alternative measures look more likely now.”

This analysis underscores the need for the RBI to adopt additional measures to stabilize the rupee liquidity and prevent negative economic impacts.

item.title: Standard Glass IPO allotment status: How to check details online via KFin Tech, NSE & BSE; Check... - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Standard Glass IPO allotment status: How to check details online via KFin Tech, NSE & BSE; Check latest GMP

Date: January 10, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Standard Glass IPO allotment status is announced, following a significant subscription rate. Investors can check their allotment status via KFin Technologies and stock exchanges.

  • The allotment is expected to be declared on January 9, with a subscription rate of 183 times.
  • The price band for the shares was Rs 133-140 each.
  • The IPO raised Rs 410.05 crore and received bids for over 381 crore shares.
  • Investors can verify their allotment status on the registrar's website and on NSE and BSE.
“Standard Glass IPO received 183.18-times subscription on the final day of bidding.”

This IPO reflects strong investor interest and substantial market activity in recent developments.

item.title: Infosys files counterclaim against Cognizant, accuses CEO Ravi Kumar of misusing sensitive information,... - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Infosys Accuses Cognizant of Anticompetitive Practices in Counterclaim

Date: January 10, 2025 Source: Moneycontrol

India’s second largest software exporter, Infosys, has filed a counterclaim against Cognizant, alleging that the company indulged in anticompetitive tactics to hinder the growth of its healthcare platform, Infosys Helix.

  • Infosys filed the counterclaim on January 10, 2025, in a US Court.
  • The lawsuit arises amid a backdrop of allegations from Cognizant’s subsidiary that Infosys stole trade secrets.
  • Infosys is requesting a jury trial and seeks to invalidate Cognizant’s Non-Disclosure Agreements.
  • The counterclaim includes a request for triple damages and attorney's fees.
“We will vigorously defend the lawsuit in court.”

This counterclaim highlights the competitive tensions in the IT sector at a time of economic uncertainty.

item.title: Quadrant Future Tek IPO allotment today: Here’s how to check status online on NSE and Link Intime - The Financial Express
item.description:
Quadrant Future Tek IPO Allotment Today: Check Status Online

Publication Date: January 10, 2024

Source: Financial Express

The Quadrant Future Tek IPO shares will be allotted to investors today, January 10. The IPO was closed on January 09 and witnessed significant demand with a total subscription of 196 times overall.

  • The retail portion was subscribed 256.46 times.
  • The non-institutional investors (NIIs) subscribed 268.03 times.
  • The qualified institutional buyers (QIBs) booked the issue 140 times.
  • The IPO price band ranged from Rs 275 to Rs 290.
  • The minimum investment for retail investors was Rs 14,500 for 50 shares.

How to Check Allotment Status

On NSE

  1. Visit the NSE website.
  2. Register with your personal details.
  3. Log in and select Quadrant Future Tek in the portal.
  4. Enter the application number and click ‘Get Data’.

On Link Intime

  1. Go to Link Intime's website.
  2. Click on the public issue section.
  3. Enter the required details and hit submit.
"The shares of Quadrant Future Tek were fetching a premium of 62% in the grey market, indicating a listing price around Rs 470."

The IPO is expected to list on January 13.

item.title: Tata Shocks Maruti Dzire & Honda Amaze With This New Feature! - MotorOctane
item.description:
Tata Shocks Maruti Dzire & Honda Amaze With This New Feature!

Publication Date: Recent updates
Source: MotorOctane

Tata recently announced updates to its most affordable cars, introducing new features that may challenge competitors like Maruti and Honda.

  • The Tigor receives exterior design updates and interior tech enhancements.
  • New features on the Tigor include a 10.25-inch touchscreen, wireless connectivity, and a 360-degree camera.
  • The Tiago also benefits from similar updates but lacks some features like the 360-degree camera.
  • The price hike for the Tigor ranges from Rs 6.90 lakh to Rs 9.77 lakh, while the Tiago is priced between Rs 5.73 lakh and Rs 8.40 lakh.
"The new Tigor and Tiago are aimed at enhancing the value proposition for customers in the affordable segment."

The enhancements in Tata's models demonstrate the brand's commitment to staying competitive in a crowded market.

item.title: Big Four consultancies ask employees to go slow on work travel, use public transport - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Big Four consultancies ask employees to go slow on work travel, use public transport

Date: January 10, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Big Four consultancies have implemented measures to limit work-related travel, encouraging employees to utilize virtual meetings and public transportation to reduce costs and support sustainability goals.

  • Employees are encouraged to minimize travel for client visits.
  • When travel is necessary, public transport is recommended.
  • These directives have been issued in the past few months in response to carbon footprint targets.
  • Recent client engagements have seen fewer employees traveling, advocating for remote coordination instead.
“But the firm took a view that it was sufficient for one partner to travel, and the rest could be coordinated online.”

This move reflects the consultancies' commitment to environmental responsibility while balancing operational effectiveness.

item.title: Bonus Share 2025: ANNOUNCEMENT on Jan 13; multibagger stock up 460% in 2 years - ET Now
item.description:
Bonus Share 2025: Announcement on Jan 13; Multibagger Stock Up 460% in 2 Years

Updated Jan 10, 2025 | Source: ET NOW News

A multibagger stock, Anand Rathi Wealth Ltd., which has delivered a whopping 460% return in the past two years, is set to announce a bonus issue on January 13.

  • The company is meeting to consider its first-ever bonus issue.
  • Bonus shares make stocks more appealing to retail investors and show financial strength.
  • As of January 10, Anand Rathi shares rose 6.35% to Rs 4,193.05.
  • The stock has a market cap of Rs 17,311 crore and a 52-week high of Rs 4,640.55.
"The Board of Directors in its meeting inter-alia would also consider a proposal for Issuance of Bonus Shares to the shareholders of the Company," - Anand Rathi Wealth Ltd.

This announcement may encourage more investment and rewards current shareholders, reflecting the company's growth and stability.

item.title: Vodafone Increases Stake in Vi to 24.39 Percent After Completing Share Placing in Indus - TelecomTalk
item.description:
Vodafone Boosts Stake in Vi to 24.39% with Indus Towers Share Placing

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: Telecom Talk

Vodafone Group Plc announced it has increased its stake in Vodafone Idea Limited (Vi) following a financial transaction involving Indus Towers that secured Vodafone's obligations.

  • Vodafone invested Rs 19.1 billion to raise its stake in Vi to 24.39 percent.
  • Rs 8.9 billion was allocated to repay borrowings and transaction fees.
  • The funds enabled Vi to settle its Master Service Agreement dues with Indus Towers.
"Vi have used the proceeds from this Capital Raise to pay outstanding Master Service Agreement (MSA) dues to Indus. Following this, Vodafone's obligations to Indus under the Security Arrangements have now been satisfied in full," Vodafone stated.

This strategic move allows Vodafone to enhance its stake in the competitive telecom market while fulfilling financial commitments to Indus Towers.

item.title: Tata Steel, SAIL, Coal India among others hit 52-week low in weak market today, check full list - Upstox
item.description:
Tata Steel, SAIL, Coal India Among Stocks Hitting 52-Week Low in Weak Market

Date: January 10, 2024

Source: Not specified

Benchmark indices witnessed losses mainly in banks, energy, and FMCG stocks despite an initial rise, with IT stocks remaining resilient.

  • Tata Elxsi Ltd hit a 52-week low of ₹5,921 after an 8% decline.
  • Tata Steel Ltd fell to ₹126.70, down 2.5%, marking a third consecutive session of decline.
  • Steel Authority of India Ltd (SAIL) dropped to ₹104.80, with concerns over entering a trading ban.
  • Coal India Ltd shares fell 2% to ₹364.70 amidst collaborations for critical minerals.
  • Additional stocks hitting 52-week lows include Bajaj Housing Finance, IRCTC, and Yes Bank among others.
“The cautious approach among investors is impacting market sentiment due to global economic uncertainties.”

The downturn in the market is attributed to global factors and declining performances of major stocks.

item.title: Defence stock Apollo Micro Systems declares preferential issue at ₹114 per share. Details here | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Apollo Micro Systems Announces Preferential Issue at ₹114 per Share

Date: 09 January 2025 Source: Live Mint

Apollo Micro Systems has declared the issuance of a preferential issue at ₹114 per share to raise funds, aiming to increase its paid-up capital.

  • The company plans to raise its paid-up capital from ₹36 crores to ₹45 crores.
  • Out of the additional ₹9 crores, ₹3.34 crores will be raised through preferential shares.
  • The issuance will consist of up to 3,34,18,806 equity shares at a price of ₹114 each.
  • The funds will be allocated to a select group of investors outside the promoter group.
“The Authorized capital of Apollo Micro Systems has been increased from ₹36 crores to ₹45 crores,” the company stated.

This preferential issue signifies Apollo Micro Systems' efforts to enhance its financial standing and support future growth.

item.title: Supreme Court stays GST proceedings against online gaming companies on Centre’s request - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Stays GST Proceedings Against Online Gaming Companies

Published on: 10 Jan 2025, 7:07 am

The Supreme Court has stayed Goods and Services Tax (GST) proceedings against 49 online gaming companies which were facing retrospective demands for taxes based on the full face value of bets placed through their platforms.

  • The stay was granted on the request of the GST department and the case is set for hearing on March 18.
  • The GST Council had imposed a 28% tax on the full face value of online gaming bets effective from October 1, 2023.
  • Online gaming companies argue that this tax method is unfair and advocate for a tax based on gross gaming revenue instead.
  • As of December 2023, 71 show-cause notices alleging GST evasion totaling ₹1.12 lakh crore were issued to online gaming companies.
  • The total liability could exceed ₹2.3 lakh crore, including interest, due to severe penalties associated with these notices.
“The ruling dealt a significant blow to the GST department, which appealed the decision directly to the Supreme Court.”

This decision represents a critical juncture in defining the tax obligations of online gaming platforms and could impact their future operations significantly.
